title: Ask students to think about a dream they might like to use for their computer writing
Second Day: (whole class writing -1 computer): 1. Load Muppet Slate, select "New
Decide on a character and add it to the dream
Decide on an appropriate name such as "MY DREAM
Encourage interested students to "produce their dream," choosing cast members from the class. Present the production to an audience of peers or videotape it for future use
There's a Nightmare in My Closet, was read, make individual covers for the papers from construction paper with a keyhole cut in the center
Instruct the students to make a fiction drawing which could be entitled "I Went Into Space or "The Muppets Went Into Space
Load Muppet Slate into the students' computers

note: and write it on the chalkboard.
title: Decide on an appropriate name such as "SPACE
Allow time for students to select "New" and type the name

note: find their paper name, and load their paper.
title: Assist students as necessary to select "Load
Add the papers to students' "I'm A Muppet Writer” booklets

title: Stickers to Update Your Muppet Learning Keys Your Muppet Learning Keys should look like the illustration above (alphabet shown uppercase and lowercase
If not, obtain additional stickers by calling Sunburst at (800
Plug the Muppet Learning Keys into the joystick port on the back of the Apple lie, lie, or IIGS

note: Avoid pressing keys on the Muppet Learning Keys while the program is loading, or the Muppet Learning Keys will not function properly.
title: Follow the steps necessary to turn on your computer and start the program

note: See page 39 for keyboard equivalents of the Muppet Learning Keys.
title: Muppet Slate may be operated by means of either the Muppet Learning Keys or the Apple keyboard
If you wish to return to the main menu during the program, hold down the Control Key and press "Q
